'''Baidu Yi''' ({{zh|c=ç¾åº¦â¢æå¹³å°|p=BÇidÃ¹-YÃ¬ pÃ­ngtÃ¡i|l=Baidu Yi Platform}}, [[wikt:æ|æ]] ''YÃ¬'' meaning "change" or "easy") is an [[operating system]] for mobile devices.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.ft.com/cms/s/2/443cd8f0-d56c-11e0-bd7e-00144feab49a.html#axzz1Ww52lmpD |title=Baidu prepares mobile operating system |publisher=Financial Times |date=2 September 2011 |accessdate=13 November 2011}}</ref> It is based on [[Google]]'s [[Android (operating system)|Android]] but is a [[fork (software)|fork]] by [[Baidu]], the dominant search engine operator in [[People's Republic of China|China]]. It was announced on 2 September 2011 at the 2011 Baidu Technology Innovation Conference in [[Beijing]].<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.chinapost.com.tw/business/company-focus/2011/09/05/315565/Baidu-launches.htm | title=Baidu launches Android-based mobile platform | publisher=The China Post | date=5 September 2011 | accessdate=7 September 2011}}</ref>
== Features == It will have Baidu applications replacing Google's for many core functions, such as the search engine, instant messenger, ebook reader, and app store.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.reuters.com/article/2011/09/02/us-baidu-idUSTRE7810OX20110902 |title=Baidu offers glimpse of new mobile OS |publisher=[[Reuters]] |date=2 September 2011 |accessdate=13 November 2011}}</ref> Baidu is expected to provide 180 gigabytes of [[cloud storage]] for users.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://techcrunch.com/2011/09/02/baidu-looks-to-leapfrog-google-with-cloud-based-mobile-os/ | title=Baidu Looks To Leapfrog Google With Cloud-Based Mobile OS (Update) | publisher=TechCrunch | date=2 September 2011 | accessdate=7 September 2011}}</ref>
==Devices== On 6 September 2011, it was reported that [[Dell]] was developing new phones that are planned to operate Yi for sale in the Chinese market; Baidu also said that it was working with other unnamed companies, including hardware manufacturers, to support the Yi platform.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-14799100 | title=Dell and Baidu tie up for smartphones in China | publisher=BBC News Online | date=6 September 2011 | accessdate=7 September 2011}}</ref>
